definition: the West/abbr. for Spain 西班牙[Xi1 ban1 ya2]/Spanish
the Pentateuch/the five books of Moses in the Old Testament

sentences.english: Moses manages to placate God momentarily, and then he turns around to face the people.
sentences.chinese: 摩西想馬上安撫上帝，他把臉轉向人民。

sentences.english: And the children of Amram； Aaron， and Moses， and Miriam.
sentences.chinese: 暗蘭的兒子是亞倫，摩西，還有女兒米利暗。

sentences.english: MOSE is a play on the Italian name for Moses.
sentences.chinese: 摩西這個字是取自義大利人名摩西而來。

sentences.english: MOSE is a play on the Italian name for Moses.
sentences.chinese: 摩西這個字是取自義大利人名摩西而來。

sentences.english: Who lived in the land in the time of Moses?
sentences.chinese: 那片土地在摩西時代居住的是什麼人？

sentences.english: Then said the LORD unto Moses, Behold, I will rain bread from heaven for you;
sentences.chinese: 耶和華對摩西說，我要將糧食從天降給你們。

sentences.english: and Moses and Aaron and his sons used it to wash their hands and feet.
sentences.chinese: 摩西和亞倫並亞倫的兒子，在這盆裏洗手洗腳。

sentences.english: All the Israelites railed against Moses and Aaron.
sentences.chinese: 所有猶太人開始指責摩西和亞倫。

sentences.english: These are the names of the men which Moses sent to spy out the land.
sentences.chinese: 這就是摩西所打發，窺探那地之人的名字。

sentences.english: When Moses was at Mount Sinai God chose to reveal his face.
sentences.chinese: 摩西在西乃山上時，上帝定意顯明祂的面。

sentences.english: And Moses brought back the people's words to the Lord.
sentences.chinese: 摩西把人們的承諾告訴了上帝。

sentences.english: She was the mother of Miriam, Aaron and Moses.
sentences.chinese: 她是米利安，亞倫和摩西的母親。

sentences.english: When Aaron and all the Israelites saw Moses, hisface was radiant, and they were afraid to come near him.
sentences.chinese: 亞倫和以色列衆人看見摩西的麪皮發光就怕挨近他。

sentences.english: So the whole book makes up the three speeches Moses gave.
sentences.chinese: 所以整本書是由摩西的三篇講論組成。

sentences.english: They envied Moses also in the camp, and Aaron the saint of the LORD.
sentences.chinese: 他們又在營中嫉妒摩西，和耶和華的聖者亞倫。

definition: Abraham (name)/Abraham, father of Judaism and Islam in the Bible and Quran/same as Ibrahim 易卜拉辛
Baal, god worshipped in many ancient Middle Eastern communities
